info.title: CREWMATE API
info.description: ### This is the documentation of the private API used by official iOS app. Do not share!

tags.name: OTP
tags.description: OTPs are used for security check.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the app details

now.description: The current server date (to use as cursor for next call)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The asset type (optional) (for gear-attributes & gear-items only)

get.description: Use this endpoint to get all assets published or updated since a given date. This endpoint is used by iOS app to retreive all the assets of the catalog

post.description: Use this endpoint to register unsynchronized asset metrics.

date.description: The date when metric has been created

get.description:
### ADMIN SCOPE REQUIRED

Use this endpoint to get the details of a given asset, and all its revisions.

delete.description:
Use this endpoint to permanently delete an asset.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

**Warning:** Assets should never be deleted when they have already been published. Prefer unpublishing them instead.

*Note: When an asset has not been published yet, it can be deleted by the author itself. In this case, the SUPERADMIN scope is not required, but only the ADMIN one.*

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to publish or unpublish an asset.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

get.description:
### ADMIN SCOPE REQUIRED

Use this endpoint to get all the revisions of a given asset, sorted by `date` newest first.

post.description:
### ADMIN SCOPE REQUIRED

Use this endpoint to create a new batch of revisions for a given asset.

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to Accept or Decline a revision.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

200.description:
OK

***Note:** Only main fields are given.*

get.description:
### ADMIN SCOPE REQUIRED

Use this endpoint to get all assets of a given type.

Allowed types are:
- `brand`
- `city`
- `crew-position`
- `crew-section`
- `project-type`
- `rental-group`
- `rental-house`
- `gear-attribute` (with optional `?entity=key` query param)
- `gear-item` (with optional `?entity=key` query param)

The body is completed depending of the type (see Models)

departments.description: The allowed departments for this asset (null means appliable to all departments)

post.description:
### ADMIN SCOPE REQUIRED

Use this endpoint to create an asset of a given type.

Allowed types are:
- `brand`
- `city`
- `crew-position`
- `crew-section`
- `project-type`
- `rental-group`
- `rental-house`
- `gear-attribute`
- `gear-item`

Use this endpoint to login user with credentials (email & password).

**Important:** for backoffice, the `admin` flag must be set. For the iOS app, the `apple_token` is required in Production environment.

The headers can ben sent on every requests, it will update the informations.

admin.description:
A flag indicating wether the admin scope should be
granted. *Default: False*

post.description: Use this endpoint to log out current user and destroy the session

get.description: Use this endpoint to get the active dynamic model. Use **?soft=true** to get only metadata (ie. `id` and `last_update`) without content.

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to update a category from dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

entity.description: The related entity key (for final categories only)

color.description: The color HTML code prefixed with # (only for root categories)

default_grouping_filter_id.description: ID of provider (filter type) used to generate sub-category

delete.description:
Use this endpoint to delete a category from dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

get.description:
Use this endpoint to get all categories for a given department.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

post.description:
Use this endpoint to create a category for a given department.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

entity.description: The related entity key (for final categories only)

color.description: The color HTML code prefixed with # (only for root categories)

default_grouping_filter_id.description: ID of provider (filter type) used to generate sub-category

get.description:
Use this endpoint to get all entities of the dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

departments.description: The appliable departments (set empty when appliable to all departments)

assets_sort_descriptors.description: Some sort descriptors for customizing the assets sorting

composable_set_items.description: The key of the entity's relationship targetting the selectable items (for composable sets only)

parentable_entities.description: The keys of the entities that can be set as parent of a given entry of the current entity. Empty array means all entities are appliable, whereas a null value (default) means no parent is assignable.

post.description:
Use this endpoint to create an entity for the dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to update an entity of the dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

assets_sort_descriptors.description: Some sort descriptors for customizing the assets sorting

composable_set_items.description: The key of the entity's relationship targetting the selectable items (for composable sets only)

parentable_entities.description: The keys of the entities that can be set as parent of a given entry of the current entity. Empty array means all entities are appliable, whereas a null value (default) means no parent is assignable.

requestBody.description:
The updated fields

**Note:** The entity's key is not editable.

delete.description:
Use this endpoint to delete permanently an entity of the dynamic model. Related assets **are not deleted**.\n\n**Important:**
Be very careful when deleting entities as they can be referenced within assets,
providers, etc.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

post.description:
Use this endpoint to create a property for an entity of the dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

type.description: Use @ prefix to make a relationship to another entity

helper.description: A localized helper message for the admin panel

array.description: A boolean indicating if multiple values are allowed for this property

default.description: The default value (for primitive properties only)

inverse.description: The property key of the inverse relationship (for relationship properties only)

keypath.description: The keypath to use for computing value(s) (for computed properties only)

sort_descriptors.description: Some sort descriptors for ordering the values (for computed properties only)

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to update a property of an entity of the dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

type.description: The property type (relationships have @ prefix followed by the destination entity key)

helper.description: A localized helper message for the admin panel

array.description: A boolean indicating if several values are allowed for this property

inverse.description: The property key of the inverse relationship (for relationship properties only)

keypath.description: The keypath to use for computing value(s) (for computed properties only)

sort_descriptors.description: Some sort descriptors for ordering the values (for computed properties only)

requestBody.description:
The updated fields

**Note:** The property's key is not editable.

delete.description:
Use this endpoint to delete a property of an entity of the dynamic model.

### Policies
| Admin Level |
| --- |
| `superadmin` |

201.description: OTP Generated and sent to user

expire_time.description: The valid period of the token in minutes

post.description: Use this endpoint to generate an One-Time Password. It is required to do some action like passwored reset. The authenticated user will receive the OTP by email. You can send it with the securised action to validate it.

200.description: List of all active prices for licence plans

post.description: This webhook is used only by RevenueCat for now

get.description: List all the projects of all users

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new project on server and get an ID

get.description: List all the projects of all users

Use this endpoint to get the collaborators details of a given project (only allowed for the project's author and active collaborators)

Add *"accepted"* or *"invited"* query params if you want only one type. Otherwise every collaborators and invitations will be sent

post.description: Use this endpoint to invite a new collaborator for a given project (only allowed for the project's author and admin collaborators)

get.description: Use this endpoint to get the details of a collaborator for a given project (only allowed for the project's author and active collaborators)

patch.description: Use this endpoint to update the authorizations of a collaborator (only allowed for the project's author and ADMIN collaborators)

requestBody.description: Provide the new authorizations for the collaborator

delete.description: Use this endpoint to remove a collaborator (or invited collaborator) from a given project (only allowed for the project's author, admin collaborators, and the collaborator itself)

get.description: Get a short-lived token for accessing the Dropbox API for that project

token.description: Token from Dropbox that has been crypted by server

expires_in.description: The number of second when the token will expire

now.description: The current server date (to provide in "since" parameter for next call)

403.description: Forbidden (User has no authorization for this project)

get.description: Use this endpoint to get the events of a given project (only allowed for the project's author and active collaborators)

since.description: The given date from last fetch (or null when fetching all events)

requestBody.description:
Results can be filtered by specifying an optional date to fetch the events from

*Notes: this date corresponds to the creation date of the event on server, not the event's date! It should only be used as a cursor.*

events_status.description: Status for all events sent in request

error.description: An optional error for debug purposes

post.description: Use this endpoint to register new events for a given project (only allowed for  the project's author or active collaborators with at least a READWRITE authorization)
Create a new revision for the given project and department.

department.description: The targeted department for the revision

parameters.name: email_verified
parameters.description: Filter only user that have email verified or not. Leave `null` to list all users
Maximum number of user by request _(default: 50)_

requestBody.description:
Results can be filtered by specifying an optional date to fetch the events from

*Notes: this date corresponds to the creation date of the event on server, not the event's date! It should only be used as a cursor.*

403.description: Forbidden (Only current user can register its events)

post.description: Use this endpoint to register new events for a given user (only allowed for  the current user itself)

get.description: Use this endpoint to get the pending invitations for a given user (only allowed for the current user itself)

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to accept or decline an invitation to collaborate
(only for the current user itself)
### Event
Content of the event when invitation accepted has :
- `accepted_date` datetime
- `user_id` uuid string

agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:47.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/47.0

get.description:
Use this endpoint to search users matching given emails or IDs

*Note: only verified users will be returned*

requestBody.description: Provide either `emails` or `IDs` (or both) depending on what you are looking for

City.title: City
City.description: A model representing a city (used for rental houses)

CrewPosition.title: CrewPosition
CrewPosition.description:
A model representing a crew position (ex. Cinematographer, Director, Producer, 1st AC...).

CrewPositions are sorted by index within each section.

When a CrewPosition is available for several departments, one (or more) entry(ies) can be created for each one.

If a position should be shared between all departments (for example a Producer, a Director...), use the special key `shared` as unique department.

departments.description: The appliable departments (an empty array means appliable to all departments). You can use 'shared' special department when the position is shared between all of them.

allows_extra.description: A boolean indicating if extra crew members are allowed for this position

CrewSection.description:
A model representing a section of the technical crew (ex. Production crew, Post-production crew, Directing crew...).

CrewSections are sorted by index.
CrewSection.title: CrewSection

ProjectType.title: ProjectType
ProjectType.description:
A model representing a type of project (ex. feature film, TV series...).

ProjectTypes are sorted by index.

episodable.description: A boolean indicating wether the project type is episodable (ie. decomposable into episods and seasons)

RentalGroup.title: RentalGroup
RentalGroup.description: A model representing a group of rental houses (ex. Panavision, Keslow Camera...)

RentalHouse.title: RentalHouse
RentalHouse.description: A model representing a rental company for a single location (ex. Panavision Hollywood, TSF Paris...)

address.description: The full address (including ZIP and city)

GearAttribute.title: GearAttribute
GearAttribute.description: A model representing a gear attribute

departments.description: The appliable departments (empty array means appliable to all departments). As the entity itself defines its appliable departments, both are combined to define the final appliable departments

properties.description: The values for properties defined within the related entity

Provider.title: Provider
Provider.description: A model representing a provider  of an entity of the dynamic model.

GearItem.title: GearItem
GearItem.description: A model representing a gear item (ie. a physical equipment) from catalog

departments.description: The appliable department (empty array means appliable to all departments)

properties.description: The values for properties defined within the related entity

deprecated.description: A boolean indicating if the Deprecated flag should be displayed

hidden.description: A boolean indicating if the item should be hidden within the catalog

AssetRevision.title: AssetRevision
AssetRevision.description: A model representing an Asset revision for a given property key.

value.description: The new value (type depends on the property key)

review_date.description: The date at which the revision has been accepted/declined

reviewer.description: The user who accepted/declined the revision

AssetRevisionBatch.title: AssetRevisionBatch
AssetRevisionBatch.description: A model representing a set of `AssetRevision` that have been made in a same request

Property.title: Property
Property.description: A model representing a property (primitive or relationship) of an entity of the dynamic model.

type.description: The property type (relationships have @ prefix followed by the destination entity key)

helper.description: A localized helper message for the admin panel

array.description: A boolean indicating if several values are allowed for this property

inverse.description: The property key of the inverse relationship (for relationship properties only)

keypath.description: The keypath to use for computing value(s) (for computed properties only)

sort_descriptors.description: Some sort descriptors for ordering the values (for computed properties only)

Entity.title: Entity
Entity.description: A model representing an entity of the dynamic model.

departments.description: The appliable departments (empty means appliable to all departments)

assets_name_template.description: A localized template for customizing the assets name

assets_sort_descriptors.description: Some sort descriptors for customizing the assets sorting

composable_set_items.description: The key of the entity's relationship targetting the selectable items (for composable sets only)

parentable_entities.description: The keys of the entities that can be set as parent of a given entry of the current entity. Empty array means all entities are appliable, whereas a null value (default) means no parent is assignable.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: A model representing a category from the dynamic model.

color.description: The HTML color code prefixed with # (for root categories only)

default_grouping_filter_id.description: ID of provider (filter type) used to generate sub-category

id.description: ID to send to select this price

amount.description: The amount for one unit in cents

Event.title: Event
Event.description:
Events can target a **Project** or a **User**.

For **Entry** related events, the `entry_type` and `entry_id` must be specified.

The events `content` depends on the event `type` and target.

### Project Events Types:
- `PROJECT_ARCHIVED`
- `ENTRY_CREATED`
- `ENTRY_MODIFIED`
- `ENTRY_DELETED`
- `COLLABORATOR_CREATED`
- `COLLABORATOR_MODIFIED`
- `COLLABORATOR_DELETED`

### User Events Types:
- `ENTRY_CREATED`
- `ENTRY_MODIFIED`
- `ENTRY_DELETED`

### Entries Types:
- `PROJECT_DETAIL`
- `CREW_MEMBER`
- `GEAR_ENTRY`
- `CUSTOM_ITEM`

app_build.description: The app's build number when event has been created

content.description: An object depending on the event's type

Session.title: SessionInfo
Session.description: A model representing a user session.

BEARER.description: A basic bearer token must be join into the header. Check [/login](#tag/Auth/operation/login)

RegisterRequest.description: Request for registering a new User

Unauthorized.description: User are not allowed to do that action

InvalidRequest.description: The user input is not correct

Validation.description: Unprocessable Entity - Validation of fields have failed

message.example: The email must be a valid email address

email: The email must be a valid email address
country_code: The country code must be at least 2 characters
The country code can't have number

since.name: since
since.description: The server date from which you want to retreive the resources

language.name: Accept-Language
language.description: The languages and local that accept the request

platform.name: Crewmate-Platform
platform.description: An enum representing the official interface that is used

notification_token.name: Crewmate-Notification-Token
notification_token.description: The token used by the current device to receive notification.

device_model.name: Crewmate-Device-Model
device_model.description: The name of the model of the current device.

device_version.name: Crewmate-Device-Version
device_version.description: The version of the current device

page.name: page
page.description: The page number you want to retreive
